page.title: 04ST. MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: The old Parish Church of St.Mary-at- Finchley dates from the fifteenth century, but with many later alterations and extensions, including the unusual feature of a second , or outer south aisle. Most imposing of the monuments iside the church is that of Alexander Kinge, Auditor to Queen Elizabeth I. He died in 1618 having lived in the Manor House in East End Road. Sir Thomas Frowicke, Lord Chief Justice of England was buried here in 1506, but his monument went to make way for an extra pew. Recently in Rectory Close, next to the Church, an excavation has revealed pottery dating from early medieval times onwards, together with a small quantity of flints from the middle ages. Christ's College school nearby has long been connected with the church.
